Class Student

java.lang.Object
com.education.ztu.game.Participant
com.education.ztu.game.Student
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable<Participant>
public class Student extends Participant
Represents a university/college student participant in the game system.

This class extends the abstract Participant class and specializes it for university and college students, typically ages 18-25. Student participants form their own teams and compete with other student teams.

Characteristics:

  • Age Range: Typically 18-25 years old
  • Team Composition: Teams can only contain other Student participants
  • Serialization: Fully serializable with custom serialVersionUID

Type Safety:

Through Java Generics in the Team class, a Team<Student> can only contain Student participants. This prevents mixing different participant types in the same team and is enforced at compile time. For example, you cannot add a Schoolar or Employee to a Student team.

Usage Example:

// Create individual student participants
Student mykola = new Student("Mykola", 20);
Student viktoria = new Student("Viktoria", 21);

// Create a team for students
Team<Student> vperedTeam = new Team<>("Vpered");

// Add students to the team
vperedTeam.addNewParticipant(mykola);
vperedTeam.addNewParticipant(viktoria);

// Create another team and play a game
Team<Student> intellectTeam = new Team<>("Intellect");
vperedTeam.playWith(intellectTeam);

Inherited Features:

Student inherits all functionality from Participant including:

  • Name and age management (Participant.getName(), Participant.getAge())
  • Cloning support (Participant.clone())
  • Serialization support
  • Natural ordering by name (Participant.compareTo(Participant))
  • Equality and hashing (Participant.equals(Object), Participant.hashCode())

Differences from Other Participant Types:

While Schoolar represents younger students and Employee represents working professionals, Student represents university/college students, a distinct group with their own developmental characteristics and competing interests.

Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • Student

      public Student(String name, int age)
      Constructs a new Student participant with the specified name and age.

      This constructor delegates to the parent Participant class constructor, which initializes the name, age, and temporary information.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the student (e.g., "Mykola", "Viktoria")
      age - the age of the student in years (typically 18-25)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if name is null
      See Also:
      • Participant(String, int)

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Student participant.

      The string includes the student's name, age, and temporary information. Format: Student{name='...', age=..., tempInfo='...'}

      This method overrides the parent Participant.toString() to provide a Student-specific string representation.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Participant
      Returns:
      a string representation containing Student{name, age, tempInfo}
